meanings.definition: To drill holes in (something) before it is used or assembled.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter predrilled the holes in the wood before putting the shelves together.
meanings.sent2: It is easier to predrill the holes in the wall before hanging the picture frame.
meanings.sent3: The eager squirrel predrilled holes in the acorns before storing them for winter.
meanings.sent4: She predrilled the path to success, making sure every step was carefully planned.
meanings.sent5: The chef predrilled the vegetables, ensuring they cooked evenly in the oven.

meanings.sent1: The predrilled pieces of wood made assembling the furniture much quicker.
meanings.sent2: The predrilled holes in the paper made it easy to organize the documents.
meanings.sent3: The predrilled donuts were a hit at the office party, saving time for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The predrilled path through the forest guided them safely to their destination.
meanings.sent5: The predrilled beads allowed the children to create beautiful necklaces without any help.
